episodes.title: “The names are in the files” | Virginia Giuffre, Prince Andrew & the Epstein files
episodes.description:
In a UK broadcast exclusive, the co-author of Virginia Giuffre's posthumous memoir, Amy Wallace, discusses the contents of the new book and calls on Prince Andrew to tell the authorities what he knows about Epstein. Interview by Victoria Derbyshire.
 
Prince Andrew denies all of the allegations made against him.

episodes.title: Newsnight - Prince Andrew Accuser: Her Story
episodes.description: The co-author of Virginia Giuffre's posthumous memoir, Amy Wallace, calls on Prince Andrew to tell the authorities what he knows. With Victoria Derbyshire.

episodes.title: "Happy & sad tears" | Virginia Giuffre’s brother responds to Prince Andrew giving up royal titles
episodes.description:
Sky and Amanda Roberts, brother and sister-in-law of Virginia Giuffre, respond to the news that Prince Andrew is losing his title of Duke of York. Interview by Matt Chorley. 

Prince Andrew denies all of the allegations made against him.

episodes.title: Virginia Giuffre's family call for Duchess of York to be stripped of royal title
episodes.description:
The family of Virginia Giuffre, one of the most prominent accusers of Jeffrey Epstein, has spoken out in an emotional interview with BBC Newsnight, calling for the Duchess of York, Sarah Ferguson, to lose her royal title after revelations emerged that she had privately apologised to Epstein and referred to him as a “supreme friend.” The interview follows the news that several charities in the UK and US have severed ties with the Duchess after the leaked email came to light. Epstein, a convicted paedophile, had already been found guilty at the time the email was sent. 

Interview by Faisal Islam. 

#PrinceAndrew #Newsnight #bbcnews

episodes.title: Epstein survivor says “monster” Ghislaine Maxwell’s prison move is "a slap in the face"
episodes.description:
Newsnight hears from a survivor of Jeffrey Epstein's abuse, Haley Robson, who delivers an emotional plea to Donald Trump. She also says convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell’s move to a minimum security prison is "a slap in the face" to all of Epstein’s victims. Interview by Matt Chorley.

episodes.title: Virginia Giuffre's lawyer explains the contents of the Epstein files
episodes.description:
As Senate Democrats pressure Donald Trump to release the full contents of the Epstein files, Sigrid McCawley, Virginia Giuffre's lawyer and who has represented multiple Jeffrey Epstein accusers, tells Adam Fleming about the type of information the files contain and why she believes it should be made available to the public.

episodes.title: "Jeffrey... had dirt on people" | Jeffrey Epstein's brother claims disgraced financier was killed
episodes.description:
Mark Epstein, brother of convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, tells Matt Chorley that he believes that his brother did not kill himself. Mark Epstein says his brother once told him during the 2016 Presidential Election, contested by Hilary Clinton and Donald Trump, that "if he said what he knew about the candidates, they would have to cancel the election". Mark Epstein also says that his brother Jeffrey and US President Donald Trump "were very close".  

Newsnight is the BBC's flagship news and current affairs TV programme - with analysis, debate, exclusives, and robust interviews.

episodes.title: "Farage is running a cult" | Rupert Lowe on Reform UK and his "political assassination attempt"
episodes.description:
In an exclusive interview, Victoria Derbyshire talks to expelled Reform UK MP Rupert Lowe, who lays into Nigel Farage and warns that he must never become prime minister.

episodes.title: Katy Morgan-Davies: Trapped in a London cult for 30 years - BBC Newsnight
episodes.description:
Katy Morgan-Davies was kept as a 'slave' by a Maoist cult leader for 30 years. She was born into the cult, didn't know who her parents were and even what mothers and fathers actually were.

Kirsty Wark takes her back to the house in Brixton, South London that she escaped from five years ago.

Newsnight is the BBC's flagship news and current affairs TV programme - with analysis, debate, exclusives, and robust interviews.
